displayName: Ensure that MySQL Database Instance does not allows root login from any Host
rationale: When root access is allowed for any host, any host from authorized networks can attempt to authenticate to a MySql Database Instance using administrative privileges. To minimize attack surface root access can explicitly allowed from only trusted IPs (Hosts) to support database related administrative tasks.
recommended_action:
1. Login to MySql database instance from authorized network
mysql connect -u root [INSTANCE_ADRESS]
2. Set host for root user
UPDATE MySql.user SET Host=[Host_name/IP] WHERE User='root';
error_message: SQL server allows root login from any host
ruleNames: Ensure that MySQL database instance does not allow root login from any host
